name: Frost
description: The Enterprise-J's mysterious and violent appearance may be the harbinger of a greater threat. But is its pilot friend or foe?
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Zero Hour Archer, any versions of Reed, Daniels, Enterprise crew or Temporal Agent crew will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-J, Kovalaan, or the NX-Class Ship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Zero Hour Archer, Reed, Daniels, Enterprise, or Temporal Agent

featured_crew.name: Phlox
featured_crew.flavor: Doctor Phlox is busy treating Klaang, who was injured by the Plasma Cannon.

action.name: I'll Do The Best I Can

featured_crew.name: Daniels
featured_crew.flavor: Posing as a steward, Daniels blended in with the USS Enterprise crew in order to capture Silik.

action.name: I Think My Bunkmate Majored In Chaos Theory

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Reed
rewards.flavor: Pushed into serving Section 31, Malcolm Reed investigated a secret Klingon program.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: NX-Class Ship
ship.flavor: The first Starfleet ships to be equipped with warp five engines, allowing exploration beyond neighboring star systems.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Captain, thank you for answering my hails. We're dealing with a rather strange assailant and could use your help here."

"You got that right. That last blast did a number on our hull. I don't care if it is the J, it's still insane that one Enterprise could do that much damage to another. And then just slip away like that. We couldn't get a shot in on the sucker before he jumped to warp!"

"As you heard, the Enterprise-J has made an appearance here. Our ships are just the newest in a long line of targets, Federation or otherwise. And there appears to be no rhyme or reason to which ships are attacked."

"Yeah, you'd figure if someone stole that ship and wanted to make a dent in our forces, they'd be going after all the big guns. But it'll pick at a flagship one minute, a runabout the next, then completely skip other ships. Think you can try and catch 'em?"
"Captain, thank you for answering my hails. We're dealing with a rather strange assailant and could use your help here."

"You got that right. That last blast did a number on our hull. I don't care if it is the J, it's still insane that one Enterprise could do that much damage to another. And then just slip away like that. We couldn't get a shot in on the sucker before he jumped to warp!"

"As you heard, the Enterprise-J has made an appearance here. Our ships are just the newest in a long line of targets, Federation or otherwise. And there appears to be no rhyme or reason to which ships are attacked."

"Yeah, you'd figure if someone stole that ship and wanted to make a dent in our forces, they'd be going after all the big guns. But it'll pick at a flagship one minute, a runabout the next, then completely skip other ships. Think you can try and catch 'em?"
"I suppose I can't keep trying to outrun you. You're every bit as capable as I've heard, Captain. I can promise you there is an explanation for this."
"It better be a damn good explanation. After what you did to my ship? Why do you have the Enterprise-J? And why did you attack us? What'd we ever do to you!?"

responses.text: "Good point. Why did you attack them?"

screens.text: "Yes, you do have a rather odd way of saying hello after so long. I don't care if you're future Starfleet or a temporal agent or what - I can't imagine any possible justification for attacking us."

"I needed to know. I needed to see if all of the players are ready for what's to come. If you think the original Temporal Cold War wrought havoc on the timestream, you won't believe what's become of it now."
"This ship has an important history at the crux of the Temporal Cold War. Not only that, but since it's here in the present anyway, its technology will prove useful to you in the coming conflict."
"I suppose that's a question that depends most on when you're asking me. I've been a lot of people in a lot of different eras, including a 'crew member' aboard the NX-01."
"I know you all have a lot of questions. Your suspicions aren't unwarranted. I would like to explain further, but first, I need to know you're capable of withstanding the threat that is to come!"
"I suppose I can't keep trying to outrun you. You're every bit as capable as I've heard, Captain. I can promise you there is an explanation for this."
"It better be a damn good explanation. After what you did to my ship? Why do you have the Enterprise-J? And why did you attack us? What'd we ever do to you!?"

responses.text: "Good point. Why did you attack them?"

screens.text: "Yes, you do have a rather odd way of saying hello after so long. I don't care if you're future Starfleet or a temporal agent or what - I can't imagine any possible justification for attacking us."

"I needed to know. I needed to see if all of the players are ready for what's to come. If you think the original Temporal Cold War wrought havoc on the timestream, you won't believe what's become of it now."
"This ship has an important history at the crux of the Temporal Cold War. Not only that, but since it's here in the present anyway, its technology will prove useful to you in the coming conflict."
"I suppose that's a question that depends most on when you're asking me. I've been a lot of people in a lot of different eras, including a 'crew member' aboard the NX-01."
"I know you all have a lot of questions. Your suspicions aren't unwarranted. I would like to explain further, but first, I need to know you're capable of withstanding the threat that is to come!"
